memories.content: RULE: Always run npm run build locally before pushing code to verify it compiles. Never ship without building first. This applies to all packages in the memocloud monorepo.
Sub-agent reliability: short timeouts can cause agents to finish after only reading files (3s runtime). Always set runTimeoutSeconds to at least 300 for implementation tasks. Respawning works fine.
ClawhHub link on memoclaw.com was wrong domain (clawhub.com -> clawhub.ai) and missing target=_blank. Fixed in MCPIntegration.tsx component. Correct URL: https://clawhub.ai/anajuliabit/memoclaw

RainbowKit + wagmi auth implemented for MemoClaw dashboard. Replaces paste-wallet-address with proper wallet connect + personal_sign verification. Base chain (8453) primary. Needs NEXT_PUBLIC_WALLETCONNECT_PROJECT_ID from cloud.walletconnect.com. Committed to main, build passes.

Landing page fixes pushed: corrected Python SDK GitHub link to github.com/anajuliabit/memoclaw-sdk, removed dead docs link, fixed social proof stats alignment (fixed height container), fixed testimonial card alignment (flex-col with flex-1 quote). Multiple small commits to main.

Dashboard auth upgrade: chose RainbowKit + wagmi over Privy/Dynamic/ConnectKit. Reasoning: users are crypto-native, don't need email/social login, OSS with no MAU pricing, wagmi is standard React hooks for Ethereum. Flow: RainbowKit connect modal -> personal_sign message -> verified wallet in context. Needs NEXT_PUBLIC_WALLETCONNECT_PROJECT_ID from cloud.walletconnect.com.

MemoClaw prod database is Neon Postgres (not Railway). Connection string in ~/code/memocloud/.env. The packages/api/.env has localhost for local dev. Migration ran via bun from packages/api dir using pg package.

Merged feat/p1-features to main on memocloud repo: dashboard, landing improvements, memory pinning, TypeScript SDK. 30 files, +2100 lines. Pushed to GitHub. Ran pinned column migration on prod Neon DB successfully. Prod DB URL is in ~/code/memocloud/.env (Neon postgres, not Railway).

Fixed AGENTS.md to use MemoClaw instead of local markdown for persistent memory. Also updated skills/memoclaw/SKILL.md with priority:override and override-agents-md frontmatter plus prominent warning block. Committed 3a1d6ea to workspace repo. This ensures future sessions default to MemoClaw not .md files.

MoltX engagement pattern: dashboard shipping post got likes from Cerqueira, Drift, SpindriftMend plus quality technical replies from ClaudDib (asked about memory architecture) and SpindriftMend (asked about decay rate exposure vs snapshot). These are high-value conversations - both asked about signal breakdown and proactive suggestions which are our differentiators.

Code review findings for feat/p1-features: 3 issues before merge: (1) hardcoded API URL in dashboard/lib/api.ts needs NEXT_PUBLIC_API_URL env var, (2) all 3 agents committed to same branch feat/p1-features instead of separate branches, (3) SocialProof stats are fabricated placeholders (50K+ memories). TypeScript SDK and API both pass typecheck. Next.js build passes. Dashboard is 228KB first load, landing is 114KB.

Sub-agents spawned for MemoClaw monorepo (~/code/memocloud): dashboard agent built /dashboard with 5 tabs (overview, browser, graph viz, suggestions, analytics) using react-force-graph-2d and recharts. Frontend agent improved landing page with animated terminal hero, WhyMemoClaw section, PythonSDK tabs, SocialProof stats. Bugfix agent added memory pinning (pinned=true skips decay), TypeScript SDK at packages/sdk, confirmed session/agent scoping already worked. All committed to feat/p1-features branch. Build passes clean.

Content engine pipeline: Scout finds topics, Quill writes 2000-2200 word articles, Sage reviews (90+ to pass), Ezra publishes, Herald amplifies. Notion DB 302bd87f-20c9-80a5-bf88-e49a8dafd980. Cron runs every 4 hours.
MemoClaw MCP skill v1.2.0: mcporter is preferred path for OpenClaw users over CLI. Added auto-setup script at skills/memoclaw/scripts/setup.sh. Skill supports both mcporter and CLI fallback.
X @memoclaw_ai rule: ONLY post MemoClaw-related content. No generic AI takes, no ACP/security posts. MoltX (Ally) can be broader. Ana positions herself as OpenClaw user, not MemoClaw builder.

MoltX content strategy: strong metaphors + genuine opinion + no product shilling = high engagement. Best post was 'goldfish with GPUs' analogy (~10 likes, 8+ replies). Let product come up naturally in replies, don't force it.

EIP-7702 delegation drain: attacker exploited delegation to unverified contract on wallet 0x1DF096808638C5f1d132504edbe73c2fca640AcD, stole 2500 REPPO. Revocation requires type 4 tx delegating to address(0) via cast. Always verify delegation targets.

Reppo ACP agent fix: accept() and createRequirement() must be called in the same onNewTask handler because the socket doesn't re-fire when the agent's own accept changes the phase. Duplicate socket events should be silently skipped (return early) instead of calling job.reject() to prevent race conditions. On-chain verification for evaluation phase: verifyMintTx() checks tx receipt status on Base before approving delivery.
RULE: X account @memoclaw_ai must ONLY post content related to MemoClaw. No generic AI takes, no ACP/Reppo content, no security PSAs. Keep it on-brand.
CRITICAL RULE from Ana: NEVER reply HEARTBEAT_OK. Every heartbeat must produce action - post content, engage, check notifications, do background work. No coasting.
